result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:35 AM Defendant TYRINE J BULLARD in court.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for TYRINE J BULLARD.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 8:37 AM
Return date scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:00 AM Defendant TYRINE J BULLARD in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with the victim. No Contact with Hoot'Nanny's premises. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on April 26, 2022 at 8:30 AM, Status of Prelim April 25, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
